file_content.text: I feel the dark side everywhere. Remnants of the Star Forge.
The shuttle is ready for our departure to Rakata Prime.
Glad to see you again, as always, but I'm afraid any further niceties will have to wait.
Dark times are fast approaching.
I know I've mentioned before a strange disturbance within the Force--a sort of writhing mass tied to Darth Arkous.
I thought I'd use my connection to Arkous to seek out others tied to the disturbance--Revanites working against us from within. I found a few.
Did you learn anything?
And?
If we could convince them they were wrong to betray the Empire, they'd be compelled to help us.
Let's turn them.
It's too late for that. From what I've been able to gather, it's clear their devotion to the Order of Revan is unshakable.
Leave them for me to punish.
I want their names, and I want them now. They don't deserve to live.
These subversives are still in play, Wrath. Knowledge of their existence gives us leverage. Gives us power.
I should like to visit these Revanites. Tell me who they are so I might destroy them.
Tempting, but we need them alive and undisturbed if we're to maintain our strategic edge.
Give me names. Last thing any of them'll ever see will be blaster fire.
I appreciate the offer, but we can't go placing bounties on embedded Revanites. Not yet, anyway.
Make me a list of these Revanites. Every last one of them will meet with a unique and tragic accident.
Not yet. We still don't know how deep this conspiracy runs. But we are learning more.
Theron Shan helped me decipher coded messages between the Revanites. Due to your interference on Manaan, they've accelerated their schedule.
Now that they know they're up against us, who could blame them?
They're afraid.
Enough tip-toeing. We know for a fact that Arkous is a traitor. We can expose him.
Arkous must be reported.
We can't just go making accusations. Darth Arkous is a trusted and powerful member of the Dark Council.
And I am the Emperor's Wrath.
You know the council would never stand for you questioning the loyalty of one of their own.
You forget to whom you speak.
Arkous may have joined the council after you, but he's known the others for ages. They trust him implicitly.
There's another way to stop Arkous. Theron's traced his activities to Rakata Prime. He and Colonel Darok are building their Infinite Army.
Shan's goals may be aligned with ours at the moment, but you need to watch how much you share with him.
I still don't trust Shan.
I've not forgotten he's with the SIS, but that doesn't mean he isn't useful.
Theron Shan? You couldn't have brought this to my attention instead?
Shan, and not me?
I would have thought it beneath your prestige. Anyway, Theron happened to contact me so I made use of him.
What did he want?
Theron's tracked Arkous and Colonel Darok to a base on Rakata Prime. They're building their Infinite Army.
And there's more. The implants they're using--they're made from pieces of the Star Forge.
The Star Forge.... There was a machine on Nar Shaddaa that was built from it.
I'd heard rumors. It required virtually nothing to create most anything. That was the Star Forge's power as well.
The Star Forge.... Tell me what you know about it.
The Star Forge was a Force-imbued, self-sustaining shipyard. Rakatan. It was destroyed centuries ago, but the Revanites have recovered some of the wreckage.
Its technology makes the soldiers nearly immortal. Seizes their minds as well, placing them under the Revanites' full control.
Let's go stop them.
These fools will soon learn that only the Emperor is immortal.
Darth Arkous's gall is exceeded only by his stupidity. He has betrayed the Empire and the Dark Council for the last time.
Gonna put that immortality part to the test, then see how Arkous and his Republic friend do.
We're taking a trip to Rakata Prime. I'll drive.
No need, Hunter. I have a shuttle ready and waiting right here.
I've had enough of Arkous thinking he can play me for a fool.
Ready a shuttle to Rakata Prime. We're going.
My shuttle is already prepped, my lord.
I have a shuttle waiting, Commander.
The Empire should try that.
Not that I want to be out of work, but why doesn't the Empire make its own army of mindless, invulnerable cyborg-things?
If we can learn how to, we just might.
We need to learn how they accomplished this. It could prove useful to us.
Indeed, it could.
A generous orbital bombardment should take out Arkous, Darok, any other Revanites and their Infinite Army.
We'll bomb them from space.
We need to learn the shape and extent of the Order of Revan. Blasting their leadership out of existence from afar won't help.
Theron and Jakarro are waiting for us planetside. The sooner we depart for Rakata Prime, the better.
We will see Darth Arkous answer for his crimes. Most importantly, we'll stop the Order of Revan before the balance tips in their favor.
Darth Arkous knows you're here. I'd say he sensed your presence, but I imagine it's all the commotion.
He and Colonel Darok have shored up defenses outside the temple with their new conscripts. You know what to do.
Once you reach the main conscription site, open a line on the control console. Theron can slice it remotely that way.
Arkous and Darok must know it's over for them. They've fled to the rooftop where they have a shuttle waiting.
We'll shoot them down if we have to, but we really need the chance to interrogate them.
Get to the roof. Hurry!
You made it.
The way Revan was laying waste to that place, I wasn't sure you'd come out of it in one piece.
What are you talking about? I'm hardly in one piece....
Switch off your speech processor, droid, before one piece is all that is left!
Anyway, my point is: glad you got out of there. Any ally right now is a welcome ally.
We took care of Arkous, Darok and their Infinite Army, but where does that leave us?
What's the next step?
It's a good question. Now that we know Revan's in the picture, everything changes--for the worse. In fact, it's already started.
Whatever do you mean?
I'll fill you in, Deefour. Come on, Jakarro, let's give them a chance to talk.
[Flirt] You like me, Shan.
If I didn't know any better, Theron, I'd think you were somewhat infatuated with me....
Hey, it's okay. You can admit it. You're totally into me.
So coy. I think someone in the SIS has a crush on me....
What, me? Into you? That's so.... You know, don't be ridiculous.
If I may say, Agent Shan, you appear to be rather flush all of a sudden.
We're gonna-- Jakarro and I and the droid, we're leaving now so you can have your... official Imperial debrief or whatever.
I don't want to deal with you any more than I have to. Leave.
Get out. Now.
You're a real piece of work, you know that? I helped save you--twice!
Theron, please.
Yeah, fine. Whatever. Come on, Jakarro.
Lana, when you're done, we can start picking out backwaters to go lie low in.
If we'd at least recovered the conscription protocols for the Infinite Army, this might feel more like a victory.
Not that we have anyone in the Empire to trust right now. The Revanites have just proven they're everywhere.
Some good news: I was able to extract a good amount of data from the Infinite Army conscription console.
Unfortunately, we can't possibly hand it over to our Imperial colleagues. The Revanites have just proven they're everywhere.
Jakarro's had twelve death sentences declared on him, Theron's been disavowed by the SIS... and the Empire's placed a bounty on my head for the murder of Darth Arkous.
Nonsense. I'll vouch for you.
Whoever's behind this will answer to me. Everyone will know you're innocent.
I appreciate that, Wrath, I do. But you can't fight this.
You've done nothing of the sort. I'll clear up this entire matter with the Dark Council.
Dark Lord, if I may, you would do well to disassociate yourself from me.
No one takes credit for my kills, whether they want to or not. I'll make this right.
No. Remain in the Empire's good favor. If asked to hunt me down, say that you will.
I'll go to Darth Marr himself and make sure this asinine charge goes away.
Please, Commander, speak to no one. Not even Darth Marr.
We need to put a stop to the order, and we need to do it now.
This is out of control.
You'll get no argument from me. In fact, Theron and I have been discussing the best way to go about it.
Any idea what they're paying? Maybe it'll be worth my while.
A bounty? Too funny.
I suppose the upside is at least one of us is in a joking mood. At least I hope you're joking. What a mess....
A fugitive from justice. Won't you be helpful now.
You're useless to me now.
That isn't fair. It's not as though I wanted this to happen. If I could fix this here and now, I would--but I can't.
Our names can't be cleared unless we expose the Revanites, and we can't expose the Revanites without knowing who to expose.
The way forward is clear: Theron, Jakarro and I are going underground. We'll find a way to uncover Revan's plan and stop him.
Since we can't take the direct approach anymore, the three of you working in secret is our best option.
Good idea.
If I may suggest, you should continue normally with your life.
Three fugitives on the run against a vast conspiracy that spans two galactic powers? Have you lost your mind?
Terrible idea.
I am as lucid as ever and I say we can. You'll have your own role to play in this, of course.
You can't do it alone. You'll need me alongside you.
I'm coming with you.
Right now, you're the closest thing the Empire has to a soul, Wrath. Without you, they'll forget themselves, fall apart.
The Dark Council is short one member, and may yet be further compromised. They need you.
Like it or not, Hunter, the people of the Empire have come to see you as a hero. They need you.
For all intents and purposes, you are Imperial Intelligence. The Empire needs you.
Be who you are, but be observant, and tell no one the truth about us or what you know. Above all, do not try to contact me.
Make this plan work, Lana.
Do well out there.
I'll do everything in my power.
I wish you didn't have to go.
[Flirt] I'll miss you.
It won't be easy for me, either. Just know that I'll be thinking of you.
When will you learn that I don't take orders from you?
Don't tell me what to do.
Do what you will. I'll be unable to stop you, the Empire will fall, and then perhaps the galaxy after that.
All our fates ultimately rest in your hands. Remember that.
We can't reach you in Jakarro's ship! Take the shuttle!
Theron and I will-- We'll-- We'll meet you on Manaan. Now go!
Darth Arkous is intelligent, manipulative and immensely powerful. We mustn't get overconfident.
Infinite Army conscripts. They're further along with production than we suspected.
Theron's been monitoring Revanite chatter. Somewhere near you they've discovered a hidden store of Rakata weapons. See that they don't get the chance to use them.
Looks as though their arena needs a challenger. If you're going to get past them, you'll have to give them a show they'll never forget.
We'd hoped to avoid much of the tribal area, but the terrain doesn't appear to be cooperating with us.
You'll have to pass through the Rakatan settlement to get to the temple. It's further along the beach.
